titleStmt.title: A politique confession of faith: calculated for the meridian of both churches. So as reading each column by it self, it suits with the belief of the most zealous papist, but putting both together, as one line, agrees with the tenets of every good Protestant. Composed for the assistance of weak Catholicks, in the necessary art of equivocation.

A politique confession of faith: calculated for the meridian of both churches. So as reading each column by it self, it suits with the belief of the most zealous papist, but putting both together, as one line, agrees with the tenets of every good Protestant. Composed for the assistance of weak Catholicks, in the necessary art of equivocation.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Benjamin Harris, in Bell-Ally in Coleman-street, at the sign of the Stationers-Arms.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "I still will stick ------- To the reformed way ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
